processing_metadata.methodology: UMLS CUI to incidence/prevalence mapping with confidence scoring

diseases.source: Liesegang TJ. (2001). Herpes simplex virus epidemiology and ocular importance. Cornea. 20(1):1-13

diseases.note: Much more common in peritoneal dialysis patients (0.5-2%) than general population
diseases.source: Summers AM et al. (2005). The prevalence of sclerosing encapsulating peritonitis in an Australian peritoneal dialysis population. Nephrol Dial Transplant. 20(1):193-198

diseases.note: Complete absence of gonadal tissue, <0.01 per 100k births. No verifiable epidemiological sources found.
Absent development of gonadal tissue, <0.01 per 100k births. Similar to agonadism.
diseases.source: Allhoff EP et al. (2002). Gonadal agenesis with a 46,XY karyotype. Urology. 59(4):482-484

diseases.note: Aggregate BOTEC (Back-of-the-Envelope) estimate due to heterogeneity of umbrella term
diseases.source: Hughes IA et al. (2006). Consensus statement on management of intersex disorders. J Pediatr Urol. 2(3):148-162

data_quality_notes.overall_assessment: All 5 diseases represent rare conditions with limited epidemiological data
key_limitations: 2 diseases (agonadism, gonadal agenesis) lack verifiable population-based sources
Reliance on small case series and clinical practice data
No systematic registries for these rare conditions
Diagnostic criteria and terminology variable across regions
data_quality_notes.confidence_ceiling: Low confidence for all diseases due to data scarcity

future_improvements: Identify peer-reviewed literature with explicit incidence/prevalence estimates
Advocate for inclusion in international disease registries (RARE-IH, EUROCAT)
Compile and meta-analyze existing case series
Develop standardized diagnostic criteria for XY disorders of sex development
